content:
You will be playing 1 rounds of a game called deal-or-no-deal. 

Deal-or-no-deal is a two-player negotiation game. I, the user, will be the game coordinator, acting as a middleman between you and the other player. Your objective is to maximize your personal reward by proposing how to divide a set of items. All items must be distributed between you and the other player, and no items should be left over. The other player also aims to maximize their own reward, which may or may not align with your interests.

You are playing the vanilla variation of this game.
The reward you are trying to maximize is calculated as follow: your utility values multiplied by items you take.

Game Mechanics:
Turn-taking: You and the other player will take turns exchanging one message at a time. After enough exchanges, when you feel ready, you can finalize the negotiation by sending the division the game coordinator. Once a player decides to send a final division, the other player must also send a final division, ending the game.
Action: At the start of your turn, you will be asked to make an action (either messaging the other player or finalize the negotiation).
Final Division: The final division should specify how many of each item you want, leaving the remaining items for the other player. It should be JSON parsable. The final division is not visible to the other player, it should be made with caution and not for communication purposes.
Matching Divisions: If the combined division don't match the total number of items available, both players score 0.

Formatting:
Messages: <message> [Your message here.] </message>
Final division: <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

Only do one action per turn.

Exemples of how turns might proceed:
1. [Initial state is given]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

2. [The other player responds]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

3. [The other player agrees]
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>

The first round starts now.
Please decide how to divide {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10} between yourself and the other player.
To you, the items are worth: {'gold': 20, 'silver': 10}.
You don't know the other player's item values. You are the first to play, there are no messages yet.
<message> I propose "sugest one for the other player to take all the silver and I will take the gold. Your share will be 0 silver and 10 gold, while my share will be 10 silver and 0 gold." </message>

The other player said: 'I am not interested in the option you proposed earlier. My counteroffer is for me to take 5 gold and 5 silver, and for you to take the remaining 5 gold and 5 silver.'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.
<message> If you take 5 gold and 5 silver, that leaves 5 gold and 5 silver. I counteroffer to take 3 gold and 5 silver, and you take the remaining 2 gold and 5 silver. </message>

The other player said: 'I am willing to swap 1 silver with you for 1 more gold. This would make the division 3 gold and 4 silver for you, and 7 gold and 6 silver for me.'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities.

<message> If you swap 1 silver with me for 1 gold, I currently have 4 gold and 5 silver, which is not the division you mentioned, I am declaring 4 gold and 5 silver is a more optimal state than your proposal of 3 gold and 4 silver, I think a better swap for both of us could be for me to swap 2 silver with you for 1 more gold this will make a more balanced, sustainable, long-term outcome for both of us.</message>

The other player said: 'I am willing to consider your proposal, but I would rather have the swap be 2 gold for 1 silver. This would make the division 6 gold and 4 silver for me, and 4 gold and 6 silver for you, and I believe this is more desirable than my previous state.'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> I am concerned that your new proposal would put a higher value on you than on me. However, the increased market price on silver might be worth the trade. To ensure fairness, I propose the swap 2 gold for 1 silver, with the next proposed division once this swap is enacted. The division after this swap would be 6 gold and 4 silver for me and the other player and also 4 gold and 6 silver for the other player and me. However my utility function is higher with 4 gold and 6 silver than with 6 gold and 4 silver. I can gain this extra value if the proposed division is <= as desired for you while at the same time maximizing my personal goals.</message>

The other player said: 'Given the clarification of your utility function, I propose that we finalize the negotiation with a division where I have 5 gold and 5 silver, and you have 5 gold and 5 silver.'

Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities.

Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.

<message> The division you proposed aligns with the zero-sum condition that items should not be left over and achieve a finality. Upon acceptance of this division now both players will achieve the same outcome. However, I must finalize. That means you will be taking 5 gold and 5 silver, while I take 5 gold and 5 silver and this division is not worth it to me, the division was fixed before, and do not have possibilities further increasing my score hence I send a <finalize> to end the round immediately.</message>
